faqs.question: What is the Quick Access Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Quick Access Panel is your primary control center for Avatar Toolkit, providing essential tools and information at a glance. It consists of three main sections:

### Armature Selection
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatar-toolkit/quick-access/armature-selection.png[/image]
Select and validate your armature from the dropdown menu. The panel shows validation status and bone count for the selected armature.

### Pose Controls
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatar-toolkit/quick-access/pose-controls.png[/image]
Manage pose-related operations:
- Start/Stop Pose Mode
- Apply Pose as Rest Position
- Create Pose Shape Keys

### Import/Export
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatar-toolkit/quick-access/import-export.png[/image]
Quick access to import and export functions:
- Import avatars (supports FBX format)
- Export menu with multiple format options

[note]The Quick Access Panel adapts its display based on your selected armature's validation status and current Blender mode (Object or Pose mode).[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Quick Access Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Optimization Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Optimization Panel provides essential tools for optimizing your avatar's materials and meshes. Let's explore each section:

### Materials Optimization
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatar-toolkit/interface/optimization-materials.png[/image]
The Materials section contains:
- **Combine Materials**: Efficiently merges similar materials to reduce draw calls

### Mesh Cleanup
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatar-toolkit/interface/optimization-cleanup.png[/image]
Tools for mesh optimization:
- **Remove Doubles**: Quick vertex merging with default settings
- **Advanced Remove Doubles**: Opens settings panel for precise vertex merging control

### Join Meshes
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatar-toolkit/interface/optimization-join.png[/image]
Mesh combination tools:
- **Join All Meshes**: Combines all avatar meshes into one
- **Join Selected Meshes**: Merges only selected mesh objects

[note]All optimization tools require a valid armature to be selected in the Quick Access Panel.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Optimization Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Tools Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Tools Panel offers a comprehensive set of utilities for avatar customization and optimization. Here's a breakdown of each section:

### General Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatar-toolkit/interface/tools-general.png[/image]
Basic utilities:
- **Convert to Resonite**: Export your avatar in Resonite-compatible format

### Separation Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatar-toolkit/interface/tools-separation.png[/image]
Mesh separation utilities:
- **Separate by Materials**: Split mesh based on material assignments
- **Separate Loose Parts**: Split disconnected mesh components

### Bone Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatar-toolkit/interface/tools-bone.png[/image]
Armature manipulation:
- **Create Digitigrade**: Convert standard legs to digitigrade setup
- **Weight Tools**: Clean up weight painting and bone constraints
- **Merge Twist Bones**: Option to combine twist bone weights

### Merge Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatar-toolkit/interface/tools-merge.png[/image]
Bone merging options:
- **Merge to Active**: Combine selected bones into active bone
- **Merge to Parent**: Merge bones with their parents
- **Connect Bones**: Create connections between bones

### Additional Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatar-toolkit/interface/tools-additional.png[/image]
Extra utilities:
- **Apply Transforms**: Apply object transformations
- **Clean Shape Keys**: Remove unused shape keys

[note]Many tools require a valid armature selection and specific Blender modes (Edit, Pose, or Object mode).[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Tools Panel interface
